intro: Lanonia magalonii, commonly known as the red-flowered lanonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
